Explanations about Options.-n:
Causes Ruby to assume the following loop around your script, which makes it
 iterate over file name arguments somewhat like sed -n or awk.
Explanations about Options.-r:
Causes Ruby to load the library using require. It is useful when using -n or
 -p.
Explanations about Options.-e:
Specifies script from command-line while telling Ruby not to search the rest
 of the arguments for a script file name.
